I have been trying to add a server and a runtime for WTP Web Services
wizard. I added a server 'MyServer'.

After doing this I did the following-
Created a new 'J2EE Web Project'. Set the default server to 'MyServer'
Created a new Web Service.
Select 'Java Bean web service'. Click Finish.

Now the runtime used is Axis while the server used is 'MyServer'. Even
though this combination of server-runtime-type is invalid still it is taken
as default. This obviously causes problems. If I go up to the 3rd page of
the wizard then an error is displayed saying that the project runtime and
selected one doesn't match and at this point the 'Next' and 'Finish' buttons
are disabled. I dont think this makes sense i.e. allowing to complete the
creation process on the first page itself while when on 3rd page its not
allowed. I logically fail to understand how a process can be completed
initially using some (wrong) default values but if I go ahead then at some
later point when the wrong combination is detected then in that case I cant
proceed.

I feel WTP should verify this server-runtime-type combination when I click
finish and display and error or disable the Finish button on the first
screen.

Looks to be like theres a bug/flaw in WTP.

This is a bug. The wizard should always choose a viable default server/RT 
configuration (when one exists) over a non-viable one. In rare cases where no 
viable server/RT exists for a given artifact type, the wizard should produce a 
clear error message when you strike Finish from page 1.

This bug now presents itself as a NullPointerException between page 2 and 3. 
The same Exception occurs on a page 1 Finish. I targeted my project to a JBoss 
server (which the Axis 1.1 Web service runtime currently does not declare 
support for in WTP) and got the following Exception in the bottom-up Web

patch 1 of 1

The attached patch is ready to be committed.
The problem here was that there was validation happening on page 3 of the wizard that was not being done anywhere in the commands, thus the inconsistency in behviour between clicking Finish on page 1 and clicking Next all way to page 3. The fix involves adding some validation in the ServerExtensionDefaultingCommand and ClientExtensionDefaultingCommand to ensure that the selected server, runtime, and type are compatible. 

I also changed the error message in the case of a server/runtime incompatibility so that it tells the user which Web service runtime and server are not compatible.
Patches committed and released as v20051126_0100.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old and it is assumed really fixed and no longer useful or need further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error.
